intro: Drymaria megalantha, commonly known as the large-flowered drymaria, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant features slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs and produces clusters of small, white or pink flowers. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in a fine, powdery coating. Drymaria megalantha is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
